values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.

properties.name: -moz-background-origin
properties.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

properties.name: -moz-binding
properties.description: The -moz-binding CSS property is used by Mozilla-based applications to attach an XBL binding to a DOM element.

properties.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
properties.description: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

properties.name: -moz-border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

values.name: url()
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -moz-border-left-colors
properties.description: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

properties.name: -moz-border-right-colors
properties.description: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

properties.name: -moz-border-top-colors
properties.description: Ske Firefox, -moz-border-bottom-colors sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

properties.name: -moz-box-align

values.name: baseline
values.description: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.description: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

properties.description: Specifies how a XUL box aligns its contents across (perpendicular to) the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: -moz-box-direction

values.name: normal
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

properties.description: Specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

properties.name: -moz-box-flex
properties.description: Specifies how a box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

properties.name: -moz-box-flexgroup
properties.description: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

properties.name: -moz-box-ordinal-group
properties.description: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

properties.name: -moz-box-orient

values.name: block-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: inline-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented vertically.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

properties.description: In Mozilla applications, -moz-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: -moz-box-pack

values.name: center
values.description: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

properties.description: Specifies how a box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: -moz-box-sizing

values.name: border-box
values.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

values.name: content-box
values.description: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

values.name: padding-box
values.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the padding box of the element.

properties.description: Box Model addition in CSS3.

properties.name: -moz-column-count

values.name: auto
values.description: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

properties.description: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

properties.name: -moz-column-gap

values.name: normal
values.description: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

properties.description: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

properties.name: -moz-column-rule
properties.description: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -moz-column-rule-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the column rule

properties.name: -moz-column-rule-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

properties.name: -moz-column-rule-width
properties.description: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

properties.name: -moz-column-width

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

properties.name: -moz-columns

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

properties.name: -moz-context-properties
properties.description: If you reference an SVG image in a webpage (such as with the element or as a background image), the SVG image can coordinate with the embedding element (its context) to have the image adopt property values set on the embedding element. To do this the embedding element needs to list the properties that are to be made available to the image by listing them as values of the -moz-context-properties property, and the image needs to opt in to using those properties by using values such as the context-fill value. This feature is available since Firefox 55, but is only currently supported with SVG images loaded via chrome:// or resource:// URLs. To experiment with the feature in SVG on the Web it is necessary to set the svg.context-properties.content.enabled pref to true.

properties.name: -moz-float-edge

values.name: border-box
values.description: The height and width properties include the content, padding and border but not the margin.

values.name: content-box
values.description: The height and width properties include the content, but not the padding, border or margin.

values.name: margin-box
values.description: The height and width properties include the content, padding, border and margin.

values.name: padding-box
values.description: The height and width properties include the content and padding but not the border or margin.

properties.description: The non-standard -moz-float-edge CSS property specifies whether the height and width properties of the element include the margin, border, or padding thickness.

No description on MDN

properties.description: The -moz-force-broken-image-icon extended CSS property can be used to force the broken image icon to be shown even when a broken image has an alt attribute.

properties.name: -moz-hyphens

values.name: auto
values.description: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: manual
values.description: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

values.name: none
values.description: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

properties.description: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

properties.name: -moz-image-region
properties.description: For certain XUL elements and pseudo-elements that use an image from the list-style-image property, this property specifies a region of the image that is used in place of the whole image. This allows elements to use different pieces of the same image to improve performance.

values.name: auto
values.description: Automatically defines the region of the image to use.

properties.name: -moz-orient

values.name: inline
values.description: The element is rendered in the same direction as the axis of the text: horizontally for horizontal writing modes, vertically for vertical writing modes.

values.name: block
values.description: The element is rendered orthogonally to the axis of the text: vertically for horizontal writing modes, horizontal for vertical writing modes.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The element is rendered horizontally.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The element is rendered vertically.

properties.description: The -moz-orient CSS property specifies the orientation of the element to which it's applied.

properties.name: -moz-outline-radius
properties.description: In Mozilla applications like Firefox, the -moz-outline-radius CSS property can be used to give an element's outline rounded corners.

properties.name: -moz-outline-radius-bottomleft
properties.description: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-bottomleft CSS property can be used to round the bottom-left corner of an element's outline.

properties.name: -moz-outline-radius-bottomright
properties.description: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-bottomright CSS property can be used to round the bottom-right corner of an element's outline.

properties.name: -moz-outline-radius-topleft
properties.description: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-topleft CSS property can be used to round the top-left corner of an element's outline.

properties.name: -moz-outline-radius-topright
properties.description: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-topright CSS property can be used to round the top-right corner of an element's outline.

properties.name: -moz-perspective

values.name: none
values.description: No perspective transform is applied.

properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.name: -moz-perspective-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

properties.name: -moz-stack-sizing

values.name: ignore
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: stretch-to-fit
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: -moz-stack-sizing is an extended CSS property. Normally, a stack will change its size so that all of its child elements are completely visible. For example, moving a child of the stack far to the right will widen the stack so the child remains visible.

properties.name: -moz-text-align-last

values.name: auto
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: center
values.description: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.description: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

properties.description: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

values.name: line-through
values.description: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

values.name: none
values.description: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

values.name: overline
values.description: Each line of text has a line above it.

values.name: underline
values.description: Each line of text is underlined.

properties.description: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

properties.name: -moz-text-decoration-style

values.name: dashed
values.description: Produces a dashed line style.

values.name: dotted
values.description: Produces a dotted line.

values.name: double
values.description: Produces a double line.

values.name: none
values.description: Produces no line.

values.name: solid
values.description: Produces a solid line.

values.name: wavy
values.description: Produces a wavy line.

values.name: none

properties.name: -moz-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: perspective
values.description: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: -moz-transform-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-type

values.name: mandatory
values.description: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.

values.name: none

values.name: proximity

properties.description: specifies the parameters of a flexible length: the positive and negative flexibility, and the preferred size.

properties.name: -ms-flex-align

values.name: baseline
values.description: If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.description: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: end
values.description: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: start
values.description: The cross-start margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.description: If the cross size property of the flexbox item is anything other than 'auto', this value is identical to 'start'.

properties.description: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

properties.name: -ms-flex-direction

values.name: column
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: column-reverse
values.description: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

values.name: row
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: row-reverse
values.description: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

properties.description: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container's main axis.

properties.name: -ms-flex-flow

values.name: column
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: column-reverse
values.description: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

values.name: nowrap
values.description: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: row
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: wrap
values.description: The flexbox is multi-line.

values.name: wrap-reverse
values.description: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

properties.name: -ms-flex-item-align

values.name: auto
values.description: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element's parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

values.name: baseline
values.description: If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.description: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: end
values.description: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: start
values.description: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.description: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

properties.description: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.

values.name: start

values.name: stretch
values.description: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

values.description: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

values.name: none

properties.name: -ms-layout-grid-line

values.name: auto
values.description: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

values.name: none
values.description: Default. No grid line is set.

properties.description: Sets or retrieves the gridline value used for rendering the text content of an element.

properties.name: -ms-layout-grid-mode

values.name: both
values.description: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.

values.name: char
values.description: Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.

values.name: line
values.description: Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.

values.name: none
values.description: No grid is used.

properties.description: Gets or sets whether the text layout grid uses two dimensions.

properties.name: -ms-layout-grid-type

values.name: fixed
values.description: Grid used for monospaced layout. All noncursive characters are treated as equal; every character is centered within a single grid space by default.

values.name: loose
values.description: Default. Grid used for Japanese and Korean characters.

values.name: strict
values.description: Grid used for Chinese, as well as Japanese (Genko) and Korean characters. Only the ideographs, kanas, and wide characters are snapped to the grid.

properties.description: Sets or retrieves the type of grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

properties.name: -ms-line-break

values.name: auto
values.description: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.

values.name: keep-all
values.description: Sequences of CJK characters can no longer break on implied break points. This option should only be used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.

values.name: newspaper
values.description: Breaks CJK scripts using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.

values.name: normal
values.description: Breaks CJK scripts using a normal set of line-breaking rules.

values.name: strict
values.description: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

properties.description: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

values.name: scrollbar
values.description: Scrollbars are typically narrow strips inserted on one or two edges of an element and which often have arrows to click on and a "thumb" to drag up and down (or left and right) to move the contents of the element.

properties.name: -ms-text-align-last

values.name: auto
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: center
values.description: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.description: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

properties.description: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

properties.name: -ms-text-autospace

values.name: ideograph-alpha
values.description: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and non-ideographic letters, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic or Hebrew.

values.name: ideograph-numeric
values.description: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and numeric glyphs.

values.name: ideograph-parenthesis
values.description: Creates extra spacing between normal (non wide) parenthesis and ideographs.

values.name: ideograph-space
values.description: Extends the width of the space character while surrounded by ideographs.

values.name: none
values.description: No extra space is created.

values.name: punctuation
values.description: Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.

properties.description: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.

properties.name: -ms-text-combine-horizontal

values.name: all
values.description: Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

values.name: digits
values.description: Attempt to typeset horizontally each maximal sequence of consecutive ASCII digits (U+0030-U+0039) that has as many or fewer characters than the specified integer such that it takes up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

values.name: none
values.description: No special processing.

properties.description: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.

properties.name: -ms-text-justify

values.name: auto
values.description: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

values.name: distribute
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

values.name: inter-cluster
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.

values.name: inter-ideograph
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.

values.name: inter-word
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.

values.name: kashida
values.description: Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.

properties.description: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

properties.name: -ms-text-kashida-space
properties.description: Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.

properties.name: -ms-text-overflow

values.name: clip
values.description: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

values.name: ellipsis
values.description: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

properties.description: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

properties.name: -ms-text-size-adjust

values.name: auto
values.description: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.description: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

properties.description: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

properties.name: -ms-text-underline-position

values.name: alphabetic
values.description: The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.

values.name: auto
values.description: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

values.name: over
values.description: The underline is aligned with the 'top' (right in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this mode, an overline also switches sides.

values.name: under
values.description: The underline is aligned with the 'bottom' (left in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. This is sometimes called 'accounting' underline.

properties.description: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

properties.name: -ms-touch-action

values.name: auto
values.description: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.

values.name: double-tap-zoom
values.description: The element will zoom on double-tap.

values.name: manipulation
values.description: The element is a manipulation-causing element.

values.name: none
values.description: The element is a manipulation-blocking element.

values.name: pan-x
values.description: The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

values.name: pan-y
values.description: The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

values.name: pinch-zoom
values.description: The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.

properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.

values.name: grippers
values.description: Grippers are always on.

values.name: none
values.description: Grippers are always off.

properties.description: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.

properties.name: -ms-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.description: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -ms-transform-origin-y
properties.description: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -ms-transform-origin-z
properties.description: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -ms-word-break

values.name: break-all
values.description: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters for non-CJK scripts.

values.name: keep-all
values.description: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.

values.name: normal
values.description: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

properties.description: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.

properties.name: -ms-word-wrap

values.name: break-word
values.description: An unbreakable 'word' may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

values.name: normal
values.description: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

properties.description: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.

properties.name: -ms-wrap-flow

values.name: auto
values.description: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.

values.name: both
values.description: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.

values.name: clear
values.description: Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.

values.name: end
values.description: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.

values.name: maximum
values.description: Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.

values.name: minimum
values.description: Inline flow content can flow around the edge of the exclusion with the smallest available space within the flow content's containing block, and must leave the other edge of the exclusion empty.

values.name: start
values.description: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.

properties.syntax: auto | both | start | end | maximum | clear
properties.description: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

properties.name: -ms-wrap-margin
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.

properties.name: -ms-wrap-through

values.name: none
values.description: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

values.name: wrap
values.description: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.

properties.description: Specifies if an element inherits its parent wrapping context. In other words if it is subject to the exclusions defined outside the element.

properties.name: -o-animation

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

properties.name: -o-animation-delay
properties.description: Defines when the animation will start.

properties.name: -o-animation-direction

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

properties.name: -o-animation-duration
properties.description: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

properties.name: -o-animation-fill-mode

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: none
values.description: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

properties.description: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

properties.name: -o-animation-iteration-count

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

properties.description: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

properties.name: -o-animation-name

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

properties.description: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

properties.name: -o-animation-play-state

values.name: paused
values.description: A running animation will be paused.

values.name: running
values.description: Resume playback of a paused animation.

properties.description: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

properties.name: -o-animation-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

properties.name: -o-border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -o-object-fit

values.name: contain
values.description: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

values.name: cover
values.description: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element's used width and height.

values.name: fill
values.description: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

values.name: none
values.description: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box

values.name: scale-down
values.description: Size the content as if 'none' or 'contain' were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.

properties.description: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

properties.name: -o-object-position
properties.description: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

properties.name: -o-tab-size
properties.description: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.

properties.name: -o-table-baseline
properties.description: Determines which row of a inline-table should be used as baseline of inline-table.

properties.name: -o-text-overflow

values.name: clip
values.description: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

values.name: ellipsis
values.description: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

properties.description: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

properties.description: The -webkit-border-before CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: -webkit-border-before-color
properties.description: The -webkit-border-before-color CSS property sets the color of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: -webkit-border-before-style
properties.description: The -webkit-border-before-style CSS property sets the style of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: -webkit-border-before-width
properties.description: The -webkit-border-before-width CSS property sets the width of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: -webkit-border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

values.name: url()
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -webkit-box-align

values.name: baseline
values.description: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.description: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

properties.description: Specifies the alignment of nested elements within an outer flexible box element.

properties.name: -webkit-box-direction

values.name: normal
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

properties.description: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-direction specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

properties.name: -webkit-box-flex
properties.description: Specifies an element's flexibility.

properties.name: -webkit-box-flex-group
properties.description: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

properties.name: -webkit-box-ordinal-group
properties.description: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

properties.name: -webkit-box-orient

values.name: block-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: inline-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented vertically.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

properties.description: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: -webkit-box-pack

values.name: center
values.description: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

properties.description: Specifies alignment of child elements within the current element in the direction of orientation.

properties.name: -webkit-box-reflect

values.name: above
values.description: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.

values.name: below
values.description: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.

values.name: left
values.description: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.

values.name: right
values.description: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.

properties.description: The -webkit-box-reflect CSS property lets you reflect the content of an element in one specific direction.

properties.name: -webkit-box-sizing

values.name: border-box
values.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

values.name: content-box
values.description: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

properties.description: Box Model addition in CSS3.

values.name: normal
values.description: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

properties.description: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

properties.name: -webkit-column-rule
properties.description: This property is a shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -webkit-column-rule-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the column rule

properties.name: -webkit-column-rule-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

properties.name: -webkit-column-rule-width
properties.description: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

properties.name: -webkit-column-span

values.name: all
values.description: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

values.name: none
values.description: The element does not span multiple columns.

values.name: brightness()

values.name: contrast()

values.name: drop-shadow()

values.name: grayscale()

values.name: hue-rotate()

values.name: invert()

values.name: opacity()

values.name: saturate()

values.name: sepia()
values.description: Converts the input image to sepia.

properties.name: -webkit-mask
properties.syntax: [ <mask-reference> || <position> [ / <bg-size> ]? || <repeat-style> || [ <box> | border | padding | content | text ] || [ <box> | border | padding | content ] ]#
properties.description: The mask CSS property alters the visibility of an element by either partially or fully hiding it. This is accomplished by either masking or clipping the image at specific points.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-attachment
properties.description: If a mask-image is specified, -webkit-mask-attachment determines whether the mask image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls along with its containing block.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-box-image

values.name: none
values.description: Used to specify that a border box is to have no mask image.

values.name: repeat
values.description: The mask image is repeated as many times as is necessary to span the border box. May include a partial image if the mask image does not divide evenly into the border box.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The mask image is stretched to contain the border box exactly.

values.name: round
values.description: The mask image is stretched somewhat and repeated such that there is no partial mask image at the end of the border box.

values.name: space
values.description: The mask image is repeated as many times as possible without stretching. There is no partial mask image at the end of the border box.

properties.description: The non-standard prefixed -webkit-mask-box-image shorthand property sets the mask image for an element's border box.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-clip
properties.description: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-composite
properties.description: The -webkit-mask-composite property specifies the manner in which multiple mask images applied to the same element are composited with one another. Mask images are composited in the opposite order that they are declared with the -webkit-mask-image property.

values.name: clear
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image are cleared.

values.name: copy
values.description: The source mask image replaces the destination mask image.

values.name: source-over
values.description: The source mask image is rendered over the destination mask image.

values.name: source-in
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image are replaced by the pixels of the source mask image; all other pixels are cleared.

values.name: source-out
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image are cleared; all remaining pixels of the source mask image are rendered.

values.name: source-atop
values.description: The pixels of the destination mask image are rendered. The pixels of the source mask image are rendered only if they overlap a nontransparent portion of the destination mask image. This causes the source mask image to have no effect.

values.name: destination-over
values.description: The destination mask image is rendered over the source mask image.

values.name: destination-in
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image remain the pixels of the destination mask image; all other pixels are cleared.

values.name: destination-out
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image are cleared; all remaining pixels of the source mask image are rendered.

values.name: destination-atop
values.description: The pixels of the source mask image are rendered. The pixels of the destination mask image are rendered only if they overlap a nontransparent portion of the destination mask image. This causes the destination mask image to have no effect.

values.name: xor
values.description: Overlapping pixels in the source mask image and the destination mask image become fully transparent if they are both fully opaque.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-image

values.name: none
values.description: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

values.name: url()
values.description: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

properties.description: Sets the mask layer image of an element.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-origin
properties.description: Specifies the mask positioning area.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-position
properties.description: The mask-position CSS property sets the initial position, relative to the mask position layer defined by mask-origin, for each defined mask image.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-position-x
properties.description: The -webkit-mask-position-x CSS property sets the initial horizontal position of a mask image.

values.name: left
values.description: Equivalent to 0%.

values.name: center
values.description: Equivalent to 50%.

values.name: right
values.description: Equivalent to 100%.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-position-y
properties.description: The -webkit-mask-position-y CSS property sets the initial vertical position of a mask image.

values.name: top
values.description: Equivalent to 0%.

values.name: bottom
values.description: Equivalent to 100%.

values.name: center
values.description: Equivalent to 50%.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-repeat
properties.description: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-repeat-x

values.name: repeat
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: no-repeat
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: space
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: round
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: The -webkit-mask-repeat-x property specifies whether and how a mask image is repeated (tiled) horizontally.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-repeat-y

values.name: repeat
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: no-repeat
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: space
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: round
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: The -webkit-mask-repeat-y property sets whether and how a mask image is repeated (tiled) vertically.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Resolved by using the image's intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image's intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

values.name: contain
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

values.name: cover
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

properties.description: Specifies the size of the mask layer images.

properties.name: -webkit-nbsp-mode

values.name: normal
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: space
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Defines the behavior of nonbreaking spaces within text.

properties.name: -webkit-overflow-scrolling

values.name: auto
values.description: Use "regular" scrolling, where the content immediately ceases to scroll when you remove your finger from the touchscreen.

values.name: touch
values.description: Use momentum-based scrolling, where the content continues to scroll for a while after finishing the scroll gesture and removing your finger from the touchscreen. The speed and duration of the continued scrolling is proportional to how vigorous the scroll gesture was. Also creates a new stacking context.

properties.description: The -webkit-overflow-scrolling CSS property controls whether or not touch devices use momentum-based scrolling for a given element.

properties.name: -webkit-padding-start
properties.description: No description on MDN

properties.name: -webkit-perspective

values.name: none
values.description: No perspective transform is applied.

properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.name: -webkit-perspective-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

properties.name: -webkit-region-fragment

values.name: auto
values.description: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

values.name: break
values.description: If the content fits within the CSS Region, then this property has no effect.

properties.description: The 'region-fragment' property controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

properties.name: -webkit-tap-highlight-color
properties.description: -webkit-tap-highlight-color is a non-standard CSS property that sets the color of the highlight that appears over a link while it's being tapped. The highlighting indicates to the user that their tap is being successfully recognized, and indicates which element they're tapping on.

properties.name: -webkit-text-fill-color
properties.description: The -webkit-text-fill-color CSS property specifies the fill color of characters of text. If this property is not set, the value of the color property is used.

properties.name: -webkit-text-security

values.name: circle
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: disc
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: square
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: -webkit-text-security is a non-standard CSS property that obfuscates characters in a <form> field (such as <input> or <textarea>) by replacing them with a shape. It only affects fields that are not of type=password.

properties.name: -webkit-text-size-adjust

values.name: auto
values.description: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.description: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

properties.description: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

properties.name: -webkit-text-stroke
properties.description: The -webkit-text-stroke CSS property specifies the width and color of strokes for text characters. This is a shorthand property for the longhand properties -webkit-text-stroke-width and -webkit-text-stroke-color.

properties.name: -webkit-text-stroke-color
properties.description: The -webkit-text-stroke-color CSS property specifies the stroke color of characters of text. If this property is not set, the value of the color property is used.

properties.name: -webkit-text-stroke-width
properties.description: The -webkit-text-stroke-width CSS property specifies the width of the stroke for text.

properties.name: -webkit-touch-callout

values.name: none
values.description: The callout is disabled.

values.name: default
values.description: The default callout is displayed.

properties.description: The -webkit-touch-callout CSS property controls the display of the default callout shown when you touch and hold a touch target.

properties.name: -webkit-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: perspective()
values.description: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin-x
properties.description: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin-y
properties.description: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin-z
properties.description: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-style

values.name: flat
values.description: All children of this element are rendered flattened into the 2D plane of the element.

properties.description: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

properties.name: -webkit-transition

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-delay
properties.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-duration
properties.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-property

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

properties.name: -webkit-user-drag

values.name: auto
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: element
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: No description on MDN

properties.name: -webkit-user-modify

values.name: read-only
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: read-write
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: read-write-plaintext-only
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Determines whether a user can edit the content of an element.

properties.name: -webkit-user-select

values.name: auto
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: none
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: text
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Controls the appearance of selection.

properties.name: accent-color
properties.description: The accent-color CSS property sets the accent color for user-interface controls generated by some elements.

values.name: auto
values.description: Represents a UA-chosen color, which should match the accent color of the platform, if any.

properties.name: additive-symbols
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor. Needs to be specified if the counter system is 'additive'.

properties.name: align-tracks
properties.description: The align-tracks CSS property sets the alignment in the masonry axis for grid containers that have masonry in their block axis.

values.name: start
values.description: The items are packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the masonry axis.

values.name: end
values.description: The items are packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the masonry axis.

values.name: center
values.description: The items are packed flush to each other toward the center of the alignment container along the masonry axis.

values.name: normal
values.description: Acts as start.

values.name: baseline first baseline
values.description:
Specifies participation in first- or last-baseline alignment: aligns the alignment baseline of the box's first or last baseline set with the corresponding baseline in the shared first or last baseline set of all the boxes in its baseline-sharing group.
      The fallback alignment for first baseline is start, the one for last baseline is end.

values.name: last baseline
values.description:
Specifies participation in first- or last-baseline alignment: aligns the alignment baseline of the box's first or last baseline set with the corresponding baseline in the shared first or last baseline set of all the boxes in its baseline-sharing group.
      The fallback alignment for first baseline is start, the one for last baseline is end.

values.name: space-between
values.description: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the masonry axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items is the same. The first item is flush with the main-start edge, and the last item is flush with the main-end edge.

values.name: space-around
