values.description: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the masonry axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items is the same. The empty space before the first and after the last item equals half of the space between each pair of adjacent items.

values.name: space-evenly
values.description: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the masonry axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items, the main-start edge and the first item, and the main-end edge and the last item, are all exactly the same.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The items stretch along the masonry axis to fill the content box. Items with definite size do not stretch.

properties.name: all

values.name: initial
values.description: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their initial values.

values.name: inherit
values.description: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their inherited values.

values.name: unset
values.description: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their inherited values if they inherit by default, or to their initial values if not.

values.name: revert
values.description:
Specifies behavior that depends on the stylesheet origin to which the declaration belongs:
    
      If the rule belongs to the author origin, the revert value rolls back the cascade to the user level, so that the specified values are calculated as if no author-level rules were specified for the element. For purposes of revert, the author origin includes the Override and Animation origins.
      If the rule belongs to the user origin, the revert value rolls back the cascade to the user-agent level, so that the specified values are calculated as if no author-level or user-level rules were specified for the element.
      If the rule belongs to the user-agent origin, the revert value acts like unset.

values.name: revert-layer
values.description: Specifies that all the element's properties should roll back the cascade to a previous cascade layer, if one exists. If no other cascade layer exists, the element's properties will roll back to the matching rule, if one exists, in the current layer or to a previous style origin.

properties.description: The all shorthand CSS property resets all of an element's properties except unicode-bidi, direction, and CSS Custom Properties. It can set properties to their initial or inherited values, or to the values specified in another cascade layer or stylesheet origin.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: Provides alternative text for assistive technology to replace the generated content of a ::before or ::after element.

properties.name: animation

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: The animation shorthand CSS property applies an animation between styles. It is a shorthand for animation-name, animation-duration, animation-timing-function, animation-delay, animation-iteration-count, animation-direction, animation-fill-mode, animation-play-state, and animation-timeline.

properties.name: animation-composition
properties.description: The animation-composition CSS property specifies the composite operation to use when multiple animations affect the same property simultaneously.

values.name: replace
values.description: The effect value overrides the underlying value of the property. This is the default value.

values.name: add
values.description: The effect value builds on the underlying value of the property. This operation produces an additive effect. For animation types where the addition operation is not commutative, the order of the operands is the underlying value followed by the effect value.

values.name: accumulate
values.description: The effect and underlying values are combined. For animation types where the addition operation is not commutative, the order of the operands is the underlying value followed by the effect value.

properties.name: animation-delay
properties.description: The animation-delay CSS property specifies the amount of time to wait from applying the animation to an element before beginning to perform the animation. The animation can start later, immediately from its beginning, or immediately and partway through the animation.

properties.name: animation-direction

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation reverses direction each cycle, with the first iteration being played forwards. The count to determine if a cycle is even or odd starts at one.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation reverses direction each cycle, with the first iteration being played backwards. The count to determine if a cycle is even or odd starts at one.

values.name: normal
values.description: The animation plays forwards each cycle. In other words, each time the animation cycles, the animation will reset to the beginning state and start over again. This is the default value.

values.name: reverse
values.description: The animation plays backwards each cycle. In other words, each time the animation cycles, the animation will reset to the end state and start over again. Animation steps are performed backwards, and easing functions are also reversed. For example, an ease-in easing function becomes ease-out.

properties.description: The animation-direction CSS property sets whether an animation should play forward, backward, or alternate back and forth between playing the sequence forward and backward.

properties.name: animation-duration
properties.description: The animation-duration CSS property sets the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

values.name: auto
values.description: For time-based animations, auto is equivalent to a value of 0s (see below). For CSS scroll-driven animations, auto fills the entire timeline with the animation.

properties.name: animation-fill-mode

values.name: backwards
values.description:
The animation will apply the values defined in the first relevant keyframe as soon as it is applied to the target, and retain this during the animation-delay period. The first relevant keyframe depends on the value of animation-direction:
    
      
        
          animation-direction
          first relevant keyframe
        
      
      
        
          normal or alternate
          0% or from
        
        
          reverse or alternate-reverse
          100% or to

values.name: both
values.description: The animation will follow the rules for both forwards and backwards, thus extending the animation properties in both directions.

values.name: forwards
values.description:
The target will retain the computed values set by the last keyframe encountered during execution. The last keyframe depends on the value of animation-direction and animation-iteration-count:
    
      
        
          animation-direction
          animation-iteration-count
          last keyframe encountered
        
      
      
        
          normal
          even or odd
          100% or to
        
        
          reverse
          even or odd
          0% or from
        
        
          alternate
          even
          0% or from
        
        
          alternate
          odd
          100% or to
        
        
          alternate-reverse
          even
          100% or to
        
        
          alternate-reverse
          odd
          0% or from

values.name: none
values.description: The animation will not apply any styles to the target when it's not executing. The element will instead be displayed using any other CSS rules applied to it. This is the default value.

properties.description: The animation-fill-mode CSS property sets how a CSS animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

properties.name: animation-iteration-count

values.name: infinite
values.description: The animation will repeat forever.

properties.description: The animation-iteration-count CSS property sets the number of times an animation sequence should be played before stopping.

properties.name: animation-name

values.name: none
values.description: A special keyword denoting no keyframes. It can be used to deactivate an animation without changing the ordering of the other identifiers, or to deactivate animations coming from the cascade.

properties.description: The animation-name CSS property specifies the names of one or more @keyframes at-rules that describe the animation to apply to an element. Multiple @keyframe at-rules are specified as a comma-separated list of names. If the specified name does not match any @keyframe at-rule, no properties are animated.

properties.name: animation-play-state

values.name: paused
values.description: The animation is currently paused.

values.name: running
values.description: The animation is currently playing.

properties.description: The animation-play-state CSS property sets whether an animation is running or paused.

properties.name: animation-range
properties.description: The animation-range CSS shorthand property is used to set the start and end of an animation's attachment range along its timeline, i.e. where along the timeline an animation will start and end.

values.name: normal
values.description: Represents the start of the timeline in the case of animation-range-start and the end of the timeline in the case of animation-range-end. This is the default value.

values.name: cover
values.description: Represents the full range of a named view progress timeline (see CSS scroll-driven animations for more details), from the point where the subject element first starts to enter the scroll port's view progress visibility range (0% progress) to the point where it has completely left it (100% progress).

values.name: contain
values.description:
Represents the range of a named view progress timeline where the subject element is fully contained by, or fully contains, the scroll port's view progress visibility range.
        
          If the subject element is smaller than the scrollport, it ranges from the point where the subject element is first completely contained by the scroll port (0% progress), to the point where it is no longer completely contained by the scroll port (100% progress).
          If the subject element is larger than the scrollport, it ranges from the point where the subject element first completely covers the scroll port (0% progress), to the point where it no longer completely covers the scroll port (100% progress).

values.name: entry
values.description: Represents the range of a named view progress timeline from the point where the subject element first starts to enter the scroll port (0% progress), to the point where it has completely entered the scroll port (100%).

values.name: exit
values.description: Represents the range of a named view progress timeline from the point where the subject element first starts to exit the scroll port (0% progress), to the point where it has completely exited the scroll port (100%).

values.name: entry-crossing
values.description: Represents the range of a named view progress timeline from the point where the subject element first starts to cross the scroll port's starting edge (0% progress), to the point where it has completely crossed the scroll port's starting edge (100%).

values.name: exit-crossing
values.description: Represents the range of a named view progress timeline from the point where the subject element first starts to cross the scroll port's end edge (0% progress), to the point where it has completely crossed the scroll port's end edge (100%).

properties.name: animation-range-end
properties.description: The animation-range-end CSS property is used to set the end of an animation's attachment range along its timeline, i.e. where along the timeline an animation will end.

properties.name: animation-range-start
properties.description: The animation-range-start CSS property is used to set the start of an animation's attachment range along its timeline, i.e. where along the timeline an animation will start.

properties.name: animation-timeline
properties.description: The animation-timeline CSS property specifies the timeline that is used to control the progress of a CSS animation.

values.name: none
values.description: The animation is not associated with a timeline.

values.name: auto
values.description: The animation's timeline is the document's default DocumentTimeline.

values.name: scroll()
values.description:
An anonymous scroll progress timeline is provided by some ancestor scroller of the current element. The function parameters allow you to select the scroller, and the scrolling axis the timeline will be measured along.
    See scroll() for more information.

values.name: view()
values.description:
An anonymous view progress timeline is provided by the subject that animation-timeline: view(); is set on. The function parameters allow you to select the scrollbar axis along which timeline progress will be tracked and an inset that adjusts the position of the box in which the subject is deemed to be visible.
    See view() for more information.

properties.name: animation-timing-function
properties.description: The animation-timing-function CSS property sets how an animation progresses through the duration of each cycle.

values.name: ease
values.description: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0), the default value, increases in velocity towards the middle of the animation, slowing back down at the end.

values.name: linear
values.description: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0), animates at an even speed.

values.name: ease-in
values.description: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0), starts off slowly, with the speed of the transition of the animating property increasing until complete.

values.name: ease-out
values.description: Equal to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0), starts quickly, slowing down the animation continues.

values.name: ease-in-out
values.description: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0), with the animating properties slowly transitioning, speeding up, and then slowing down again.

values.name: cubic-bezier(p1, p2, p3, p4)
values.description: An author defined cubic-bezier curve, where the p1 and p3 values must be in the range of 0 to 1.

values.name: steps(n, <jumpterm>)
values.description:
Displays an animation iteration along n stops along the transition, displaying each stop for equal lengths of time. For example, if n is 5, there are 5 steps. Whether the animation holds temporarily at 0%, 20%, 40%, 60% and 80%, on the 20%, 40%, 60%, 80% and 100%, or makes 5 stops between the 0% and 100% along the animation, or makes 5 stops including the 0% and 100% marks (on the 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%) depends on which of the following jump terms is used:
    
      jump-start
      
        Denotes a left-continuous function, so that the first jump happens when the animation begins;
      
      jump-end
      
        Denotes a right-continuous function, so that the last jump happens when the animation ends;
      
      jump-none
      
        There is no jump on either end. Instead, holding at both the 0% mark and the 100% mark, each for 1/n of the duration.
      
      jump-both
      
        Includes pauses at both the 0% and 100% marks, effectively adding a step during the animation iteration.
      
      start
      
        Same as jump-start.
      
      end
      
        Same as jump-end.

values.name: step-start
values.description: Equal to steps(1, jump-start)

values.name: step-end
values.description: Equal to steps(1, jump-end)

values.name: jump-start
values.description: Denotes a left-continuous function, so that the first jump happens when the animation begins;

values.name: jump-end
values.description: Denotes a right-continuous function, so that the last jump happens when the animation ends;

values.name: jump-none
values.description: There is no jump on either end. Instead, holding at both the 0% mark and the 100% mark, each for 1/n of the duration.

values.name: jump-both
values.description: Includes pauses at both the 0% and 100% marks, effectively adding a step during the animation iteration.

values.name: start
values.description: Same as jump-start.

values.name: end
values.description: Same as jump-end.

properties.name: appearance
properties.description: The appearance CSS property is used to display UI elements with platform-specific styling, based on the operating system's theme.

values.name: none
values.description: 隐藏部件的某些特性，例如 select 元素中显示的指示列表可以展开的箭头。

values.name: auto
values.description: 用户代理根据元素选择适当的特殊样式。对于没有特殊样式的元素，其行为类似于 none。

values.name: button
values.description: 该元素曾经被绘制为一个按钮。

values.name: checkbox
values.description: 该元素曾经被绘制为一个复选框，包括实际的“复选框”部分。

values.name: radio
values.description: 该元素曾经被绘制为单选按钮，包括实际的“单选按钮”部分。

values.name: checkbox-container
values.description: 该元素的外观类似于复选框的容器，可能包括在某些平台下的光照预设背景效果。通常它会包含一个标签和一个复选框。

values.name: color-well
values.description: input type=color

values.name: list-button
values.description: datalist

values.name: menulist-textfield
values.description: 该元素被样式化为下拉列表的文本字段。（未在 Windows 平台上实现）

values.name: meterbar
values.description: 使用 meter 来代替。

values.name: progressbar
values.description: 该元素的样式类似于进度条。可以使用 progress-bar 样式来实现

values.name: searchfield-results-decoration
values.description: 可以在 Windows 7 上的 Chrome 51 上使用。

values.name: textfield-multiline
values.description: 使用 textarea 代替。

values.name: -apple-pay-button
values.description: 仅适用于 iOS 和 macOS。从 iOS 10.1 和 macOS 10.12 开始，在 Web 上可用。

properties.name: ascent-override
properties.description: Describes the ascent metric of a font.

properties.name: aspect-ratio
properties.description: The aspect-ratio CSS property allows you to define the desired width-to-height ratio of an element's box. This means that even if the parent container or viewport size changes, the browser will adjust the element's dimensions to maintain the specified width-to-height ratio. The specified aspect ratio is used in the calculation of auto sizes and some other layout functions.

values.name: auto
values.description: Replaced elements with an intrinsic aspect ratio use that aspect ratio, otherwise the box has no preferred aspect ratio. Size calculations involving intrinsic aspect ratio always work with the content box dimensions.

properties.name: azimuth
properties.syntax: <angle> | [ [ left-side | far-left | left | center-left | center | center-right | right | far-right | right-side ] || behind ] | leftwards | rightwards
properties.description: In combination with elevation, the azimuth CSS property enables different audio sources to be positioned spatially for aural presentation. This is important in that it provides a natural way to tell several voices apart, as each can be positioned to originate at a different location on the sound stage. Stereo output produce a lateral sound stage, while binaural headphones and multi-speaker setups allow for a fully three-dimensional stage.

properties.name: backdrop-filter
properties.description: The backdrop-filter CSS property lets you apply graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element. Because it applies to everything behind the element, to see the effect you must make the element or its background at least partially transparent.

values.name: none
values.description: No filter is applied to the backdrop.

properties.name: backface-visibility

values.name: hidden
values.description: The back face is hidden, effectively making the element invisible when turned away from the user.

values.name: visible
values.description: The back face is visible when turned towards the user.

properties.description: The backface-visibility CSS property sets whether the back face of an element is visible when turned towards the user.

properties.name: background-attachment

values.name: fixed
values.description: The background is fixed relative to the viewport. Even if an element has a scrolling mechanism, the background doesn't move with the element. (This is not compatible with background-clip: text.)

values.name: local
values.description: The background is fixed relative to the element's contents. If the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents, and the background painting area and background positioning area are relative to the scrollable area of the element rather than to the border framing them.

values.name: scroll
values.description: The background is fixed relative to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

properties.description: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether a background image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls with its containing block.

properties.name: background-blend-mode

values.name: normal
values.description: Default attribute which specifies no blending

values.name: multiply
values.description: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.

values.name: screen
values.description: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

values.name: overlay
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

values.name: darken
values.description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: lighten
values.description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: color-dodge
values.description: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: color-burn
values.description: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: hard-light
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: soft-light
values.description: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: difference
values.description: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color..

values.name: exclusion
values.description: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

values.name: hue
values.description: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: saturation
values.description: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: color
values.description: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: luminosity
values.description: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

properties.description: The background-blend-mode CSS property sets how an element's background images should blend with each other and with the element's background color.

properties.name: background-origin
properties.description: The background-origin CSS property sets the background's origin: from the border start, inside the border, or inside the padding.

values.name: border-box
values.description: The background is positioned relative to the border box.

values.name: padding-box
values.description: The background is positioned relative to the padding box.

values.name: content-box
values.description: The background is positioned relative to the content box.

properties.name: background-position
properties.description: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin.

properties.name: background-position-x

values.name: center
values.description: Aligns the center of the background image with the center of the background position layer.

values.name: left
values.description: Aligns the left edge of the background image with the left edge of the background position layer.

values.name: right
values.description: Aligns the right edge of the background image with the right edge of the background position layer.

properties.description: The background-position-x CSS property sets the initial horizontal position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin.

properties.name: background-position-y

values.name: bottom
values.description: Aligns the bottom edge of the background image with the bottom edge of the background position layer.

values.name: center
values.description: Aligns the vertical center of the background image with the vertical center of the background position layer.

values.name: top
values.description: Aligns the top edge of the background image with the top edge of the background position layer.

properties.description: The background-position-y CSS property sets the initial vertical position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin.

properties.name: background-repeat
properties.description: The background-repeat CSS property sets how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal and vertical axes, or not repeated at all.

properties.name: background-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Scales the background image in the corresponding direction such that its intrinsic proportions are maintained.

values.name: contain
values.description:
Scales the image as large as possible within its container without cropping or stretching the image.
      If the container is larger than the image, this will result in image tiling, unless the background-repeat property is set to no-repeat.

values.name: cover
values.description:
Scales the image (while preserving its ratio) to the smallest possible size to fill the container (that is: both its height and width completely cover the container), leaving no empty space.
      If the proportions of the background differ from the element, the image is cropped either vertically or horizontally.

values.name: background-size
values.description: 背景图片按指定大小渲染。

values.name: auto auto
values.description: 图像如果有两个长度，则按这个尺寸。如果没有固有尺寸与固有比例，则按背景区的大小。如果没有固有尺寸但是有固有比例，效果同 contain。如果有一个长度与比例，则由此长度与比例计算大小。如果有一个长度但是没有比例，则使用此长度与背景区相应的长度。

properties.description:
The background-size CSS property sets the size of the element's background image.
  The image can be left to its natural size, stretched, or constrained to fit the available space.

properties.name: base-palette
properties.description: The base-palette CSS descriptor is used to specify the name or index of a pre-defined palette to be used for creating a new palette. If the specified base-palette does not exist, then the palette defined at index 0 will be used.

properties.name: behavior
properties.description: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser.

properties.name: bleed
properties.description: The bleed CSS at-rule descriptor, used with the @page at-rule, specifies the extent of the page bleed area outside the page box. This property only has effect if crop marks are enabled using the marks property.

properties.name: block-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: The block-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.

properties.name: border-block
properties.description: The border-block CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-block-color
properties.description: The border-block-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-end
properties.description: The border-block-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-block-end-color
properties.description: The border-block-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-end-style
properties.description: The border-block-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-end-width
properties.description: The border-block-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-start
properties.description: The border-block-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-block-start-color
properties.description: The border-block-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-start-style
properties.description: The border-block-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-start-width
properties.description: The border-block-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-style
properties.description: The border-block-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-block-width
properties.description: The border-block-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-collapse

values.name: collapse
values.description: Adjacent cells have shared borders (the collapsed-border table rendering model).

values.name: separate
values.description: Adjacent cells have distinct borders (the separated-border table rendering model).

properties.description: The border-collapse CSS property sets whether cells inside a <table> have shared or separate borders.

properties.name: border-end-end-radius
properties.description: The border-end-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.

properties.name: border-end-start-radius
properties.description: The border-end-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.

properties.name: border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: none
values.description: Use the border styles.

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

values.name: url()
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: The border-image CSS property draws an image around a given element. It replaces the element's regular border.

properties.name: border-image-outset
properties.description: The border-image-outset CSS property sets the distance by which an element's border image is set out from its border box.

values.name: inherit
values.description: 四个方向的值都继承于父元素的该属性计算后值。

properties.name: border-image-repeat

values.name: repeat
values.description: The source image's edge regions are tiled (repeated) to fill the gap between each border. Tiles may be clipped to achieve the proper fit.

values.name: round
values.description: The source image's edge regions are tiled (repeated) to fill the gap between each border. Tiles may be stretched to achieve the proper fit.

values.name: space
values.description: The source image's edge regions are tiled (repeated) to fill the gap between each border. Extra space will be distributed in between tiles to achieve the proper fit.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The source image's edge regions are stretched to fill the gap between each border.

values.name: inherit
values.description: 继承父级元素的计算值。

properties.description: The border-image-repeat CSS property defines how the edge regions and middle region of a source image are adjusted to fit the dimensions of an element's border image. The middle region can be displayed by using the keyword "fill" in the border-image-slice property.

properties.name: border-image-slice

values.name: fill
values.description: Preserves the middle image region and displays it like a background image, but stacked above the actual background. Its width and height are sized to match the top and left image regions, respectively.

properties.description: The border-image-slice CSS property divides the image specified by border-image-source into regions. These regions form the components of an element's border image.

properties.name: border-image-source

values.name: none
values.description: No border image is used. The appearance defined by border-style is displayed instead.

properties.description: The border-image-source CSS property sets the source image used to create an element's border image.

properties.name: border-image-width

values.name: auto
values.description: The width of the border is made equal to the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding border-image-slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension, the corresponding border-width is used instead.

properties.description: The border-image-width CSS property sets the width of an element's border image.

properties.name: border-inline
properties.description: The border-inline CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-inline-color
properties.description: The border-inline-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-end
properties.description: The border-inline-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-inline-end-color
properties.description: The border-inline-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-end-style
properties.description: The border-inline-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-end-width
properties.description: The border-inline-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-start
properties.description: The border-inline-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.

properties.name: border-inline-start-color
properties.description: The border-inline-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-start-style
properties.description: The border-inline-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-start-width
properties.description: The border-inline-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-style
properties.description: The border-inline-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-inline-width
properties.description: The border-inline-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.

properties.name: border-spacing
properties.description: The border-spacing CSS property sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells in a <table>. This property applies only when border-collapse is separate.

values.name: inherit
values.description: 一个表示父元素的 border-spacing 的计算值的关键字，其父元素必须应用了 border-spacing 。

properties.name: border-start-end-radius
properties.description: The border-start-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.

properties.name: border-start-start-radius
properties.description: The border-start-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.

properties.name: box-align

values.name: start
values.description: The box aligns contents at the start, leaving any extra space at the end.

values.name: center
values.description: The box aligns contents in the center, dividing any extra space equally between the start and the end.

values.name: end
values.description: The box aligns contents at the end, leaving any extra space at the start.

values.name: baseline
values.description: The box aligns the baselines of the contents (lining up the text). This only applies if the box's orientation is horizontal.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The box stretches the contents so that there is no extra space in the box.

properties.description: The box-align CSS property specifies how an element aligns its contents across its layout in a perpendicular direction. The effect of the property is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: box-decoration-break

values.name: clone
values.description: Each box fragment is rendered independently with the specified border, padding, and margin wrapping each fragment. The border-radius, border-image, and box-shadow are applied to each fragment independently. The background is also drawn independently for each fragment, which means that a background image with background-repeat: no-repeat may nevertheless repeat multiple times.

values.name: slice
values.description: The element is initially rendered as if its box were not fragmented, after which the rendering for this hypothetical box is sliced into pieces for each line/column/page. Note that the hypothetical box can be different for each fragment since it uses its own height if the break occurs in the inline direction, and its own width if the break occurs in the block direction. See the CSS specification for details.

properties.description: The box-decoration-break CSS property specifies how an element's fragments should be rendered when broken across multiple lines, columns, or pages.

properties.name: box-direction

values.name: normal
values.description: The box lays out its contents from the start (the left or top edge).

values.name: reverse
values.description: The box lays out its contents from the end (the right or bottom edge).

values.name: inherit
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: The box-direction CSS property specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

properties.name: box-flex
properties.description: The -moz-box-flex and -webkit-box-flex CSS properties specify how a -moz-box or -webkit-box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

properties.name: box-flex-group
properties.description: The box-flex-group CSS property assigns the flexbox's child elements to a flex group.

properties.name: box-lines

values.name: single
values.description: Box elements lay out in a single row or column.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Box elements layout in multiple rows or columns.

properties.description: The box-lines CSS property determines whether the box may have a single or multiple lines (rows for horizontally oriented boxes, columns for vertically oriented boxes).

properties.name: box-ordinal-group
properties.description: The box-ordinal-group CSS property assigns the flexbox's child elements to an ordinal group.

properties.name: box-orient

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The box lays out its contents horizontally.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The box lays out its contents vertically.

values.name: inline-axis
values.description: The box displays its children along the inline axis.

values.name: block-axis
values.description: The box displays its children along the block axis.

values.name: inherit
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: The box-orient CSS property sets whether an element lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: box-pack

values.name: start
values.description: The box packs contents at the start, leaving any extra space at the end.

values.name: center
values.description: The box packs contents in the center, dividing any extra space equally between the start and the end.

values.name: end
values.description: The box packs contents at the end, leaving any extra space at the start.

values.name: justify
values.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the value as if it were start.

properties.description: The -moz-box-pack and -webkit-box-pack CSS properties specify how a -moz-box or -webkit-box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: break-after

values.name: always
values.description: Forces a page break right after the principal box. The type of this break is that of the immediately-containing fragmentation context. If we are inside a multicol container then it would force a column break, inside paged media (but not inside a multicol container) a page break.

values.name: auto
values.description: Allows, but does not force, any break (page, column, or region) to be inserted right after the principal box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoids any break (page, column, or region) from being inserted right after the principal box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.description: Avoids any column break right after the principal box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.description: Avoids any page break right after the principal box.

values.name: column
values.description: Forces a column break right after the principal box.

values.name: left
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right after the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a left page. It's the page placed on the left side of the spine of the book or the back side of the page in duplex printing.

values.name: page
values.description: Forces a page break right after the principal box.

values.name: right
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right after the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a right page. It's the page placed on the right side of the spine of the book or the front side of the page in duplex printing.

values.name: all
values.description: Forces a page break right after the principal box. Breaking through all possible fragmentation contexts. So a break inside a multicol container, which was inside a page container would force a column and page break.

values.name: recto
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right after the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a recto page. (A recto page is a right page in a left-to-right spread or a left page in a right-to-left spread.)

values.name: verso
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right after the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a verso page. (A verso page is a left page in a left-to-right spread or a right page in a right-to-left spread.)

values.name: avoid-region
values.description: Avoids any region break right after the principal box.

values.name: region
values.description: Forces a region break right after the principal box.

properties.syntax: auto | avoid | always | all | avoid-page | page | left | right | recto | verso | avoid-column | column | avoid-region | region
properties.description: The break-after CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave after a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.

properties.name: break-before

values.name: always
values.description: Forces a page break right after the principal box. The type of this break is that of the immediately-containing fragmentation context. If we are inside a multicol container then it would force a column break, inside paged media (but not inside a multicol container) a page break.

values.name: auto
values.description: Allows, but does not force, any break (page, column, or region) to be inserted right before the principal box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoids any break (page, column, or region) from being inserted right before the principal box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.description: Avoids any column break right before the principal box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.description: Avoids any page break right before the principal box.

values.name: column
values.description: Forces a column break right before the principal box.

values.name: left
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right before the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a left page. It's the page placed on the left side of the spine of the book or the back side of the page in duplex printing.

values.name: page
values.description: Forces a page break right before the principal box.

values.name: right
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right before the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a right page. It's the page placed on the right side of the spine of the book or the front side of the page in duplex printing.

values.name: all
values.description: Forces a page break right after the principal box. Breaking through all possible fragmentation contexts. So a break inside a multicol container, which was inside a page container would force a column and page break.

values.name: recto
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right before the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a recto page. (A recto page is a right page in a left-to-right spread or a left page in a right-to-left spread.)

values.name: verso
values.description: Forces one or two page breaks right before the principal box, whichever will make the next page into a verso page. (A verso page is a left page in a left-to-right spread or a right page in a right-to-left spread.)

values.name: avoid-region
values.description: Avoids any region break right before the principal box.

values.name: region
values.description: Forces a region break right before the principal box.

properties.syntax: auto | avoid | always | all | avoid-page | page | left | right | recto | verso | avoid-column | column | avoid-region | region
properties.description: The break-before CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave before a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.

properties.name: break-inside

values.name: auto
values.description: Allows, but does not force, any break (page, column, or region) to be inserted within the principal box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoids any break (page, column, or region) from being inserted within the principal box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.description: Avoids any column break within the principal box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.description: Avoids any page break within the principal box.

values.name: avoid-region
values.description: Avoids any region break within the principal box.

properties.description: The break-inside CSS property sets how page, column, or region breaks should behave inside a generated box. If there is no generated box, the property is ignored.

properties.name: caption-side

values.name: bottom
values.description: The caption box should be positioned below the table.

values.name: top
values.description: The caption box should be positioned above the table.

values.name: block-start
values.description: The caption box should be positioned at the block start edge of the table.

values.name: block-end
values.description: The caption box should be positioned at the block end edge of the table.

values.name: inline-start
values.description: The caption box should be positioned at the inline start edge of the table.

values.name: inline-end
values.description: The caption box should be positioned at the inline end edge of the table.

properties.syntax: top | bottom | block-start | block-end | inline-start | inline-end
properties.description: The caption-side CSS property puts the content of a table's <caption> on the specified side. The values are relative to the writing-mode of the table.

properties.name: caret
properties.description: Shorthand for setting caret-color and caret-shape.

properties.name: caret-color

values.name: auto
values.description:
The user agent selects an appropriate color for the caret. This is generally currentcolor, but the user agent may choose a different color to ensure good visibility and contrast with the surrounding content, taking into account the value of currentcolor, the background, shadows, and other factors.
    
      Note: While user agents may use currentcolor (which is usually animatable) for the auto value, auto is not interpolated in transitions and animations.

properties.description: The caret-color CSS property sets the color of the insertion caret, the visible marker where the next character typed will be inserted. This is sometimes referred to as the text input cursor. The caret appears in elements such as <input> or those with the contenteditable attribute. The caret is typically a thin vertical line that flashes to help make it more noticeable. By default, it is black, but its color can be altered with this property.

properties.name: caret-shape

values.name: auto
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: bar
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: block
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: underscore
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.description: Specifies the desired shape of the text insertion caret.

properties.name: clear

values.name: both
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear past both left and right floats.

values.name: left
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear past left floats.

values.name: none
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is not moved down to clear past floating elements.

values.name: right
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear past right floats.

values.name: inline-start
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear floats on start side of its containing block, that is the left floats on ltr scripts and the right floats on rtl scripts.

values.name: inline-end
values.description: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear floats on end side of its containing block, that is the right floats on ltr scripts and the left floats on rtl scripts.

properties.syntax: none | left | right | both | inline-start | inline-end
properties.description: The clear CSS property sets whether an element must be moved below (cleared) floating elements that precede it. The clear property applies to floating and non-floating elements.

properties.name: clip

values.name: auto
values.description: The element does not clip (default). This is different from rect(auto, auto, auto, auto), which clips to the element's inside border edges.

values.name: rect()
values.description: Specifies offsets from the edges of the border box.

properties.description: The clip CSS property defines a visible portion of an element. The clip property applies only to absolutely positioned elements — that is, elements with position:absolute or position:fixed.

properties.name: clip-path

values.name: none
values.description: No clipping path is created.

values.name: url()
values.description: References a <clipPath> element to create a clipping path.

values.name: inset()
values.description: Defines an inset rectangle.

values.name: circle()
values.description: Defines a circle using a radius and a position.

values.name: ellipse()
values.description: Defines an ellipse using two radii and a position.

values.name: polygon()
values.description: Defines a polygon using an SVG filling rule and a set of vertices.

values.name: path()
values.description: Defines a shape using an optional SVG filling rule and an SVG path definition.

values.name: margin-box
values.description: Uses the margin box as the reference box.

values.name: border-box
values.description: Uses the border box as the reference box.

values.name: padding-box
values.description: Uses the padding box as the reference box.

values.name: content-box
values.description: Uses the content box as the reference box.

values.name: fill-box
values.description: Uses the object bounding box as the reference box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.description: Uses the stroke bounding box as the reference box.

values.name: view-box
values.description: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as the reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the element creating the SVG viewport, the reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute and the dimension of the size of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

properties.description: The clip-path CSS property creates a clipping region that sets what part of an element should be shown. Parts that are inside the region are shown, while those outside are hidden.

properties.name: clip-rule

values.name: evenodd
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

values.name: nonzero
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

properties.description: Indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

properties.name: color-interpolation-filters

values.name: auto
values.description: Color operations are not required to occur in a particular color space.

values.name: linearRGB
values.description: Color operations should occur in the linearized RGB color space.

values.name: sRGB
values.description: Color operations should occur in the sRGB color space.

properties.description: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

properties.name: color-scheme
properties.description: The color-scheme CSS property allows an element to indicate which color schemes it can comfortably be rendered in.

values.name: normal
values.description: Indicates that the element isn't aware of any color schemes, and so should be rendered using the browser's default color scheme.

values.name: light
values.description: Indicates that the element can be rendered using the operating system light color scheme.

values.name: dark
values.description: Indicates that the element can be rendered using the operating system dark color scheme.

values.name: only
values.description:
Forbids the user agent from overriding the color scheme for the element.
    Can be used to turn off color overrides caused by Chrome's Auto Dark Theme, by applying color-scheme: only light; on a specific element or :root.

properties.name: column-count

values.name: auto
values.description: The number of columns is determined by other CSS properties, such as column-width.

properties.description: The column-count CSS property breaks an element's content into the specified number of columns.

properties.name: column-fill

values.name: auto
values.description: Columns are filled sequentially. Content takes up only the room it needs, possibly resulting in some columns remaining empty.

values.name: balance
values.description: Content is equally divided between columns. In fragmented contexts, such as paged media, only the last fragment is balanced. Therefore in paged media, only the last page would be balanced.

values.name: balance-all
values.description: Content is equally divided between columns. In fragmented contexts, such as paged media, all fragments are balanced.

properties.description: The column-fill CSS property controls how an element's contents are balanced when broken into columns.

properties.name: column-gap

values.name: normal
values.description: The browser's default spacing is used between columns. For multi-column layout this is specified as 1em. For all other layout types it is 0.

properties.description: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.

properties.name: column-rule
properties.description: The column-rule shorthand CSS property sets the width, style, and color of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.

properties.name: column-rule-color
properties.description: The column-rule-color CSS property sets the color of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.

properties.name: column-rule-style
properties.description: The column-rule-style CSS property sets the style of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.

properties.name: column-rule-width
properties.description: The column-rule-width CSS property sets the width of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout.

properties.name: column-span

values.name: all
values.description: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appears. The element establishes a new block formatting context.

values.name: none
values.description: The element does not span multiple columns.

properties.description: The column-span CSS property makes it possible for an element to span across all columns when its value is set to all.

properties.name: column-width

values.name: auto
values.description: The width of the column is determined by other CSS properties, such as column-count.

properties.description: The column-width CSS property sets the ideal column width in a multi-column layout. The container will have as many columns as can fit without any of them having a width less than the column-width value. If the width of the container is narrower than the specified value, the single column's width will be smaller than the declared column width.

properties.name: columns

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: The columns CSS shorthand property sets the number of columns to use when drawing an element's contents, as well as those columns' widths.

properties.name: contain

values.name: none
values.description: The element renders as normal, with no containment applied.

values.name: strict
values.description: All containment rules are applied to the element. This is equivalent to contain: size layout paint style.

values.name: content
values.description: All containment rules except size are applied to the element. This is equivalent to contain: layout paint style.

values.name: size
values.description: Size containment is applied to the element in both the inline and block directions. The size of the element can be computed in isolation, ignoring the child elements. This value cannot be combined with inline-size.

values.name: layout
values.description: The internal layout of the element is isolated from the rest of the page. This means nothing outside the element affects its internal layout, and vice versa.

values.name: style
values.description: For properties that can affect more than just an element and its descendants, the effects don't escape the containing element. Counters and quotes are scoped to the element and its contents.

values.name: paint
values.description: Descendants of the element don't display outside its bounds. If the containing box is offscreen, the browser does not need to paint its contained elements — these must also be offscreen as they are contained completely by that box. If a descendant overflows the containing element's bounds, then that descendant will be clipped to the containing element's border-box.

values.name: inline-size
values.description: Inline size containment is applied to the element. The inline size of the element can be computed in isolation, ignoring the child elements. This value cannot be combined with size.

properties.syntax: none | strict | content | [ [ size || inline-size ] || layout || style || paint ]
properties.description:
The contain CSS property indicates that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent from the rest of the document tree.
  Containment enables isolating a subsection of the DOM, providing performance benefits by limiting calculations of layout, style, paint, size, or any combination to a DOM subtree rather than the entire page. Containment can also be used to scope CSS counters and quotes.

properties.name: contain-intrinsic-block-size
properties.description: The contain-intrinsic-block-size CSS logical property defines the block size of an element that a browser can use for layout when the element is subject to size containment.

values.name: none
values.description: The element has no intrinsic block size.

properties.name: contain-intrinsic-height
properties.description: The contain-intrinsic-length CSS property sets the height of an element that a browser can use for layout when the element is subject to size containment.

values.name: none
values.description: The element has no intrinsic height.

properties.name: contain-intrinsic-inline-size
properties.description: The contain-intrinsic-inline-size CSS logical property defines the inline-size of an element that a browser can use for layout when the element is subject to size containment.

values.name: none
values.description: The element has no intrinsic inline-size.

properties.name: contain-intrinsic-size
properties.description: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS shorthand property sets the size of an element that a browser will use for layout when the element is subject to size containment.

values.name: none
values.description: The element has no intrinsic size in the given dimension(s).

values.name: auto [<length> | none]
values.description:
A remembered value of the "normally rendered" element size if one exists and the element is skipping its contents (for example, when it is offscreen); otherwise the specified <length>.
      The none keyword may be used in place of <length> where 0px fixed lengths behave differently than none (such as in multi column, or grid layouts).

properties.name: contain-intrinsic-width
properties.description: The contain-intrinsic-width CSS property sets the width of an element that a browser will use for layout when the element is subject to size containment.

values.name: none
values.description: The element has no intrinsic width.

properties.name: container
properties.description: The container shorthand CSS property establishes the element as a query container and specifies the name or name for the containment context used in a container query.

properties.name: container-name
properties.description:
The container-name CSS property specifies a list of query container names used by the @container at-rule in a container query.
  A container query will apply styles to elements based on the size of the nearest ancestor with a containment context.
  When a containment context is given a name, it can be specifically targeted using the @container at-rule instead of the nearest ancestor with containment.

properties.name: container-type

values.name: normal
values.description: The element is not a query container for any container size queries, but remains a query container for container style queries.

values.name: size
values.description:
Establishes a query container for container size queries on both the inline and block axis in both the inline and block dimensions.
      Applies layout containment, style containment, and size containment to the container.

values.name: inline-size
values.description:
Establishes a query container for dimensional queries on the inline axis of the container.
      Applies layout, style, and inline-size containment to the element.

properties.description: The container-type CSS property is used to define the type of containment used in a container query.

properties.name: content

values.name: attr()
values.description: The attr(n) function returns as a string the value of attribute n for the subject of the selector.

values.name: counter(name)
values.description: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

values.name: icon
values.description: The (pseudo-)element is replaced in its entirety by the resource referenced by its 'icon' property, and treated as a replaced element.

values.name: none
values.description:
When applied to a pseudo-element, the pseudo-element is not generated.
      When applied to an element, the value has no effect.

values.name: normal
values.description: The default value. Computes to none for the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements. For other pseudo-elements, the content will be the initial (or normal) content expected for that ::marker, ::placeholder, or ::file-selector-button. For regular elements or page margin boxes, this computes to contents.

values.name: url()
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: contents
values.description: Adds the contents of the element itself to the generated content value.

values.name: attr(x)
values.description: The attr(x) CSS function retrieves the value of an attribute of the selected element, or the pseudo-element's originating element. The value of the element's attribute x is an unparsed string representing the attribute name. If there is no attribute x, an empty string is returned. The case sensitivity of the attribute name parameter depends on the document language.

values.name: counter()
values.description: The counter() function has two forms: 'counter(name)' or 'counter(name, style)'. The generated text is the value of the innermost counter of the given name in scope at the given pseudo-element. It is formatted in the specified <list-style-type> (decimal by default).

values.name: counters()
values.description: The counters() function also has two forms: 'counters(name, string)' or 'counters(name, string, style)'. The generated text is the value of all counters with the given name in scope at the given pseudo-element, from outermost to innermost, separated by the specified string. The counters are rendered in the indicated <list-style-type> (decimal by default).

values.name: open-quote
values.description: These values are replaced by the appropriate string from the quotes property.

values.name: close-quote
values.description: These values are replaced by the appropriate string from the quotes property.

values.name: no-open-quote
values.description: Introduces no content, but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

values.name: no-close-quote
values.description: Introduces no content, but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

values.name: attr(X)
values.description: 将元素的 X 属性以字符串形式返回。如果该元素没有 X 属性，则返回一个空字符串。区分大小写的属性返回值依赖文挡的语言设定。

properties.description: The content CSS property replaces content with a generated value. It can be used to define what is rendered inside an element or pseudo-element. For elements, the content property specifies whether the element renders normally (normal or none) or is replaced with an image (and associated "alt" text). For pseudo-elements and margin boxes, content defines the content as images, text, both, or none, which determines whether the element renders at all.

properties.name: content-visibility

values.name: visible
values.description: No effect. The element's contents are laid out and rendered as normal.

values.name: auto
values.description: The element turns on layout containment, style containment, and paint containment. If the element is not relevant to the user, it also skips its contents. Unlike hidden, the skipped contents must still be available as normal to user-agent features such as find-in-page, tab order navigation, etc., and must be focusable and selectable as normal.

values.name: hidden
values.description: The element skips its contents. The skipped contents must not be accessible to user-agent features, such as find-in-page, tab-order navigation, etc., nor be selectable or focusable. This is similar to giving the contents display: none.

properties.description: The content-visibility CSS property controls whether or not an element renders its contents at all, along with forcing a strong set of containments, allowing user agents to potentially omit large swathes of layout and rendering work until it becomes needed. It enables the user agent to skip an element's rendering work (including layout and painting) until it is needed — which makes the initial page load much faster.

properties.name: counter-increment

values.name: none
values.description: No counter must be incremented. This is used as the default value, or to cancel an increment in more specific rules.

properties.description: The counter-increment CSS property increases or decreases the value of a CSS counter by a given value.

properties.name: counter-reset

values.name: none
values.description:
No counter reset is to be performed.
      This can be used to override a counter-reset defined in a less specific rule.

properties.description:
The counter-reset CSS property resets a CSS counter to a given value.
  This property will create a new counter or reversed counter with the given name on the specified element.

properties.name: counter-set
properties.description: The counter-set CSS property sets a CSS counter to a given value. It manipulates the value of existing counters, and will only create new counters if there isn't already a counter of the given name on the element.

values.name: none
values.description: No counter set is to be performed. This can be used to override a counter-set defined in a less specific rule.

properties.name: cursor

values.name: alias
values.description: Indicates an alias of/shortcut to something is to be created. Often rendered as an arrow with a small curved arrow next to it.

values.name: all-scroll
values.description: Indicates that the something can be scrolled in any direction. Often rendered as arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle.

values.name: auto
values.description: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

values.name: cell
values.description: Indicates that a cell or set of cells may be selected. Often rendered as a thick plus-sign with a dot in the middle.

values.name: col-resize
values.description: Indicates that the item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.

values.name: context-menu
