values.description: A context menu is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as an arrow with a small menu-like graphic next to it.

values.name: copy
values.description: Indicates something is to be copied. Often rendered as an arrow with a small plus sign next to it.

values.name: crosshair
values.description: A simple crosshair (e.g., short line segments resembling a '+' sign). Often used to indicate a two dimensional bitmap selection mode.

values.name: default
values.description: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.

values.name: e-resize
values.description: Indicates that east edge is to be moved.

values.name: ew-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional east-west resize cursor.

values.name: grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: help
values.description: Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.

values.name: move
values.description: Indicates something is to be moved.

values.name: -moz-grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: -moz-grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: -moz-zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: -moz-zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

values.name: ne-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from north-east corner.

values.name: nesw-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-east/south-west cursor.

values.name: no-drop
values.description: Indicates that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location. Often rendered as a hand or pointer with a small circle with a line through it.

values.name: none
values.description: No cursor is rendered for the element.

values.name: not-allowed
values.description: Indicates that the requested action will not be carried out. Often rendered as a circle with a line through it.

values.name: n-resize
values.description: Indicates that north edge is to be moved.

values.name: ns-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-south cursor.

values.name: nw-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from north-west corner.

values.name: nwse-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-west/south-east cursor.

values.name: pointer
values.description: The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.

values.name: progress
values.description: A progress indicator. The program is performing some processing, but is different from 'wait' in that the user may still interact with the program. Often rendered as a spinning beach ball, or an arrow with a watch or hourglass.

values.name: row-resize
values.description: Indicates that the item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

values.name: se-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from south-east corner.

values.name: s-resize
values.description: Indicates that south edge is to be moved.

values.name: sw-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from south-west corner.

values.name: text
values.description: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam.

values.name: vertical-text
values.description: Indicates vertical-text that may be selected. Often rendered as a horizontal I-beam.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that the program is busy and the user should wait. Often rendered as a watch or hourglass.

values.name: -webkit-grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: -webkit-grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: -webkit-zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: -webkit-zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

values.name: w-resize
values.description: Indicates that west edge is to be moved.

values.name: zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

values.name: keyword
values.description:
A keyword value must be specified, indicating either the type of cursor to use, or the fallback cursor to use if all specified icons fail to load.
    The available keywords are listed in the table below. Other than none, which means no cursor, there is an image showing how the cursors used to be rendered. You can hover your mouse over the table rows to see the effect of the different cursor keyword values on your browser today.
    
      
        
          Category
          Keyword
          Example
          Description
        
      
      
        
          General
          auto
          
          The UA will determine the cursor to display based on the current context. E.g., equivalent to text when hovering text.
        
        
          default
          
            
          
          The platform-dependent default cursor. Typically an arrow.
        
        
          none
          
          No cursor is rendered.
        
        
          Links & status
          context-menu
          
            
          
          A context menu is available.
        
        
          help
          
            
          
          Help information is available.
        
        
          pointer
          
            
          
          The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link. Typically an image of a pointing hand.
        
        
          progress
          
            
          
          
            The program is busy in the background, but the user can still interact
            with the interface (in contrast to wait).
          
        
        
          wait
          
            
          
          
            The program is busy, and the user can't interact with the interface (in contrast to progress).
            Sometimes an image of an hourglass or a watch.
          
        
        
          Selection
          cell
          
            
          
          The table cell or set of cells can be selected.
        
        
          crosshair
          
            
          
          Cross cursor, often used to indicate selection in a bitmap.
        
        
          text
          
            
          
          The text can be selected. Typically the shape of an I-beam.
        
        
          vertical-text
          
            
          
          The vertical text can be selected. Typically the shape of a sideways I-beam.
        
        
          Drag & drop
          alias
          
            
          
          An alias or shortcut is to be created.
        
        
          copy
          
            
          
          Something is to be copied.
        
        
          move
          
            
          
          Something is to be moved.
        
        
          no-drop
          
            
          
          
            An item may not be dropped at the current location.[Firefox bug 275173](https://bugzil.la/275173):
            On Windows and macOS, no-drop is the same as not-allowed.
          
        
        
          not-allowed
          
            
          
          The requested action will not be carried out.
        
        
          grab
          
            
          
          Something can be grabbed (dragged to be moved).
        
        
          grabbing
          
            
          
          Something is being grabbed (dragged to be moved).
        
        
          Resizing & scrolling
          all-scroll
          
            
          
          
            Something can be scrolled in any direction (panned).[Firefox bug 275174](https://bugzil.la/275174):
            On Windows, all-scroll is the same as move.
          
        
        
          col-resize
          
            
          
          
            The item/column can be resized horizontally.
            Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.
          
        
        
          row-resize
          
            
          
          
            The item/row can be resized vertically.
            Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.
          
        
        
          n-resize
          
            
          
          
            Some edge is to be moved. For example, the se-resize cursor is used when the movement starts from the south-east corner of the box.In some environments, an equivalent bidirectional resize cursor is shown.
            For example, n-resize and s-resize are the same as ns-resize.
          
        
        
          e-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          s-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          w-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          ne-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          nw-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          se-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          sw-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          ew-resize
          
            
          
          Bidirectional resize cursor.
        
        
          ns-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          nesw-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          nwse-resize
          
            
          
        
        
          Zooming
          zoom-in
          
            
          
          
            Something can be zoomed (magnified) in or out.
          
        
        
          zoom-out

values.name: url
values.description: url(…)或者逗号分隔的url(…), url(…), …，指向图片文件。用大于一个<url>()值提供后备，以防某些指针图片类型不被支持。最后必须提供一个非 URL 后备值。详情参见cursor 属性中使用 URL 值。

properties.syntax: [ [ <url> [ <x> <y> ]? , ]* [ auto | default | none | context-menu | help | pointer | progress | wait | cell | crosshair | text | vertical-text | alias | copy | move | no-drop | not-allowed | e-resize | n-resize | ne-resize | nw-resize | s-resize | se-resize | sw-resize | w-resize | ew-resize | ns-resize | nesw-resize | nwse-resize | col-resize | row-resize | all-scroll | zoom-in | zoom-out | grab | grabbing ] ]
properties.description: The cursor CSS property sets the mouse cursor, if any, to show when the mouse pointer is over an element.

properties.name: descent-override
properties.description: Describes the descent metric of a font.

properties.name: direction

values.name: ltr
values.description: Text and other elements go from left to right. This is the default value.

values.name: rtl
values.description: Text and other elements go from right to left.

properties.description: The direction CSS property sets the direction of text, table columns, and horizontal overflow. Use rtl for languages written from right to left (like Hebrew or Arabic), and ltr for those written from left to right (like English and most other languages).

properties.name: empty-cells

values.name: hide
values.description: No borders or backgrounds are drawn.

values.name: -moz-show-background
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: show
values.description: Borders and backgrounds are drawn like in normal cells.

properties.description: The empty-cells CSS property sets whether borders and backgrounds appear around <table> cells that have no visible content.

properties.name: enable-background

values.name: accumulate
values.description: If the ancestor container element has a property of new, then all graphics elements within the current container are rendered both on the parent's background image and onto the target.

values.name: new
values.description: Create a new background image canvas. All children of the current container element can access the background, and they will be rendered onto both the parent's background image canvas in addition to the target device.

properties.description: Deprecated. Use 'isolation' property instead when support allows. Specifies how the accumulation of the background image is managed.

properties.name: fallback
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a fallback counter style to be used when the current counter style can't create a representation for a given counter value.

properties.name: fill

values.name: url()
values.description: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: 'hatch', 'linearGradient', 'mesh', 'pattern', 'radialGradient' and 'solidcolor'.

values.name: none
values.description: No paint is applied in this layer.

properties.description: Paints the interior of the given graphical element.

properties.name: fill-opacity
properties.description: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

properties.name: fill-rule

values.name: evenodd
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

values.name: nonzero
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

properties.description: Indicates the algorithm (or winding rule) which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

properties.name: filter

values.name: none
values.description: No filter effects are applied.

values.name: blur()
values.description: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

values.name: brightness()
values.description: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

values.name: contrast()
values.description: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

values.name: drop-shadow()
values.description: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

values.name: grayscale()
values.description: Converts the input image to grayscale.

values.name: hue-rotate()
values.description: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

values.name: invert()
values.description: Inverts the samples in the input image.

values.name: opacity()
values.description: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

values.name: saturate()
values.description: Saturates the input image.

values.name: sepia()
values.description: Converts the input image to sepia.

values.name: url()
values.description: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

properties.description: The filter CSS property applies graphical effects like blur or color shift to an element. Filters are commonly used to adjust the rendering of images, backgrounds, and borders.

properties.name: float

values.name: inline-end
values.description: The element must float on the end side of its containing block. That is the right side with ltr scripts, and the left side with rtl scripts.

values.name: inline-start
values.description: The element must float on the start side of its containing block. That is the left side with ltr scripts, and the right side with rtl scripts.

values.name: left
values.description: The element must float on the left side of its containing block.

values.name: none
values.description: The element must not float.

values.name: right
values.description: The element must float on the right side of its containing block.

properties.description: The float CSS property places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it. The element is removed from the normal flow of the page, though still remaining a part of the flow (in contrast to absolute positioning).

properties.name: flood-color
properties.description: Indicates what color to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

properties.name: flood-opacity
properties.description: Indicates what opacity to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

values.name: bold

values.name: bolder
values.description: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

values.name: caption
values.description: The system font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).

values.name: icon
values.description: The system font used to label icons.

values.name: italic
values.description: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.

values.name: large
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: larger
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: lighter
values.description: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

values.name: medium
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: menu
values.description: The system font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).

values.name: message-box
values.description: The system font used in dialog boxes.

values.name: normal
values.description: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

values.name: oblique
values.description: Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

values.name: small
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: small-caps
values.description: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

values.name: small-caption
values.description: The system font used for labeling small controls.

values.name: smaller
values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: status-bar
values.description: The system font used in window status bars.

values.description: No description on MDN

values.description: No description on MDN

values.name: xx-small
values.description: No description on MDN

properties.syntax: [ [ <'font-style'> || <font-variant-css21> || <'font-weight'> || <'font-stretch'> ]? <'font-size'> [ / <'line-height'> ]? <'font-family'> ] | caption | icon | menu | message-box | small-caption | status-bar
properties.description: The font CSS shorthand property sets all the different properties of an element's font. Alternatively, it sets an element's font to a system font.

properties.name: font-display
properties.description: The font-display descriptor determines how a font face is displayed based on whether and when it is downloaded and ready to use.
